inn1.comm: steams in, swings the ball away on a good length... swings it for a wide first ball
good shape from Willey, appreciable swing with the new ball, defended off the back foot
length ball, around off stump, meets it with a purposeful forward defensive
woosh, takes off and zips past the outside edge as Roy flirts with it, good ball from Abbott
past the bat again, straightening a touch, Roy not quite got the pace of the surface yet
fullish, going on towards off stump, comes off the toe of the bat as Roy prods forward
straighter, whipped to leg, just a tickle of bat on it and Roy picks up his first run behind square
slightly overpitched and clattered through the covers, coming forward and he picks the gap, first boundary for Roy
squares him up, 139kph back of a length and it came off the thigh pad, I think, runs through gully
slightly full outside off, Hales leans into a square drive, opens the face, finds backward point
tight on off stump, stabbed down in defence
banged in short, climbing high over everyone... including de Kock, runs away for byes
comes forward and drives back to the bowler
in the channel, reaches for the drive and fails to connect again
on the front foot, length ball pushed on the up back towards mid-off
slightly full, Roy dances out and clubs the ball over mid-on, gets a hefty chunk of it and clears the fielder
length delivery, angled in and worked wide of Morkel at mid-on for one
comes forward on off stump and dabs into the off side
short ball, outside off and lets it go
shortish at the body, attempted flick to leg and it ricochets off the thigh pad to the off side
short ball, dug in and it sits up nicely for Roy to club it through square leg, beats the man on the fence comfortably
worked off the body into a gap at midwicket
full outside off, shuffles across and pokes into the covers for one
shortish, Roy is hit on the body attempting to work to leg again
slightly overpitched but Hales finds mid-off driving
bit of width, Hales chases one back of a length, gets a thick edge and it runs wide of the slips for four
comes forward, punched to mid-off again
gets across on off stump and taps down into the covers
width on offer and Hales stays low, bending over a back cut like he's Hurricane Higgins lining up a pot, slapped for four
tighter lines from Abbott, dabbed down towards point
jaffa! Climbing past the bat from back of a length, Roy feeling for it unsuccessfully
short ball from Rabada and Roy sees all of this, waits in the crease and muscles a pull well in front of square for four
fuller, on off stump, shows it a straight bat
flicked off the body, midwicket cleans up

slashed over gully, in the air but it bounces wide of third man, Roy wants a second... Morkel gets the return in hard and flat over the stumps, de Kock breaks the bails smartly and then throws for the non-striker's end as well, seemingly doubting whether he had managed to beat Roy. But a quick check upstairs confirms Roy's bat was millimetresshort! He's run himself out!
banged in short, over the top of leg stump, Root flinches out of the way
whipped through the leg side, Rabada has to run around from fine leg to cut it off
gets across to a length ball
shuffles into line and taps the ball into a gap in the covers for one
short of a length, Root drops back and nudges into the leg side to get going
angling in with the gangling arm, Hales tucks it to midwicket
short of a length outside off, drops back and runs one wide of the slips
drops back and tucks the ball into the leg side
pitched up, Hales plants the front foot and crumps a drive to cover
little bit of width for Hales as he drops back and guides one to third man
shortish outside off, Root hops into line and blocks
dug in, rising towards the arm pit, Root fends it away
Rabada lets go a full toss, maybe trying to bluff Root, he's ready and waiting, however, and bunts through midwicket
back of a length outside off, dropped down towards backward point
Root stays back and pushes into the covers
peppers the middle of the pitch, Root turns the ball square and midwicket prevents a run
fuller and straighter, worked through mid-on and they scamper a single
banged in, a bumper outside off and Hales tries to fetch it over midwicket for four... and instead gets a top edge over the keeper for four
on the stumps, glanced through midwicket

driven on the up, towards mid-off and Hales sets off... which was probably ill-advised with de Villiers the fielder, his throw would have caught Hales short, had it hit. Hales actually half-collided with Abbott, which didn't help him
short of a length and tucked to the leg side
drops back outside off and taps it down defensively

hits on the up, couple of steps down the pitch and Root carves a length ball over mid-on, not quite out of the middle but clears the man and runs away for his first boundary. Rare forcing shot from Root
shuffles across and pushes to mid-off from the crease
bit of width, drops back and slices wide of third man, they will get back for comfortably this time
pitched up around off stump, Hales mistimes a drive towards mid-off
gets across and pushes into a gap in the covers this time
length ball, 128kph on off stump, Root sits on it in defence
short ball, at the batsman who swivels and tonks a pull out towards deep midwicket
Morkel loses his line down the leg side, Hales flicks at it it... and a brush of the pads saves the bowler from a wide
length, slightly wide and cutting his fingers over the ball, Hales sits back and steers one to third man
signs of variable bounce, Abbott hits a length outside off, stays low as Hales chops down and fails to connect
digs this one in short and it can-cans well over Hales' head for an extra
offcutter from Abbott and this is perilously close to a drag on, Hales thick-edging down past his stumps
worked into the leg side, they take it on... and there's a direct hit this time. But Hales was home
short ball, Root rocks back and cracks a pull out of the middle, straight to deep midwicket
length on off stump, poked in front of square
full outside off, Hales tries to tee off... but this won't find the fairway, dribbles towards mid-off
shortish, scrambled seam, Root stays back and opens the face
back of a length outside off, dropped towards point
full and wide, comes forward to drive, reaching away from his body slightly but the ball squirts in the air past backward point for a couple
short and pulled from off stump through square leg
bouncer, rising sharply off a proud seam as Hales ducks it
another well-directed bumper to finish the over, again Hales elects not to take it on
on the stumps, goes back and nurdles one off his hips
cutter from Wiese, length outside off and Hales chops it on to his front pad playing away from his body
fired in full on leg stump, 130kph and rattling the pads as Hales flicks across the line
Hales heaves to leg, trying to go into Beast Mode but he only succeeds in inside-edging to fine leg
bit more finesse does the job for Root, times a flick to leg and the ball races past midwicket and away
good length, presses forward to defend this time
tossed up and pushed down the ground for one
on the stumps, skipping on and Root taps it away
flighted, uses the feet and drills one more to long-on
flat legbreak on off stump, reaches forward and dabs into the off side
nicely done, fractionally short from Tahir and Hales threads a cross-batted thwack between cover and mid-off for four
tossed up higher, comes forward and smothers it
shortish outside off stump, tapped in front of square on the back foot
walks across and flicks a single through midwicket
superb bit of work from du Plessis, leaping at backward point to take Hales' back-foot chop at the top of the bounce
comes across, punched wide of mid-off
good length outside off, Root moves smoothly into a square drive... but this time du Plessis flings himself to his right to cut it off, eliciting further admiration from the crowd
angled in with the arm, worked through a gap at midwicket
on the stumps, whipped to midwicket, this time de Villiers pulls off a smart stop in the field
edges forward and punches one down the ground to long-on
drops back and attempts to cut, steers it to point
quicker delivery from Tahir, beats the bat as Hales angles his bat outside off
very full, swatted firmly behind square, the fielder cuts it off on the bounce
tossed up outside off, Root gets on to the front foot and punches through mid-off
up on the toes, cutting back into the right-hander from back of a length, pushed to cover
width, and a sweet flowing drive out to deep cover. The sweeper is in place but that was textbook
nurdled off the pad to short backward square, and Tahir's flat shy pings the stumps! Root, however, is easily home. Sharp running once again
outside off, angling in, Hales goes fishing but that salmon isn't biting
moo! A big flat-footed whoosh of willow, aimed somewhere dramatic over extra cover. My favourite shot in the nets, and a similarly airy result
dabbed out to square leg, and that's the fifty stand. Solid work ...
full length, pushed to mid-on
crunched out to point, and once again sharp hands at point to cut off another run
punched off the back foot, picked up at midwicket
down on one knee, flat-batted over midwicket. That'll do the trick
smeared out to deep square leg, a shot of similar intent but it was rather dragged behind square rather than thwacked in front
nudged to the leg-side, tidy enough from Tahir so far
short, and an ambitious wipe through the leg side. No contact
dabbed to cover, another single
driven, not quite to the pitch of the ball and for an instant Wiese thought he might reach a slightly lofted shot. But it was too wide of him
short, plonk. Through square leg, flat as a dover sole.
onto the front foot and punched out to extra cover
whisked off the pads, picked up behind square
driven in the air and, jeepers, Faf nearly lost his block there as an ugly bounce reared at his gob in the covers. Tidied up in the deep
swept, top-edged, but perfectly safe as fine leg rushes around to collect. A long chase
forward and pushed into the covers again
battered through the gap at extra cover. Two men glance askance at one another, neither can come close to cutting it off
swept, aggressive intent, and Hales once again finds a gaping wound of a gap behind square. He's allying placement to power now ...
belted, handsomely, all the way over wide mid-on! Wiese drags the ball short and Root fancies some of that, and some!
clipped urgently off the toes, England have the hammer down now. As well they might. With Buttler et al lurking in the middle order, it would be rude to loiter
up on the toes, worked to leg
nurdled to mid-on

edged and dropped! A really tough chance for de Kock, diving low to his right as Root deliberately opened the face to glide a cutter through third man. Not as much bat as he had intended but the lack of pace made it a really big ask for the keeper
worked into the covers, another lively over
Hales, one away from a landmark, bides his time ...

slower ball, on the pads, worked to leg, he made a mess of a similar shot on 99 in the last match, but that is another excellently worked half-century. Sixty balls so far, and oodles of overs to build on his start
short, and paddled behind square, slapped away like a wasp at a picnic
good rotation of the strike
Root joins Hales on a half-century with a gentle push into the gap
short, panned behind square and Behardien sticks out a palm to intercept a bouncing bomb on the boundary's edge. Good intervention saves the boundary
down the leg side, swinging away, de Kock dives well to save the extra extras
big stride, not quite big enough to pull off the intended cover drive to a wide half-volley, but a fat inside edge finds four through fine leg instead. They all count
worked to leg, and there's the 100 stand. The milestones keep on coming
outside off, there to be hit, but Hales can't quite time his splat through point
slower ball, cutting off a good length and striking the pad, but that was sliding way down leg
leading edge! That could have gone anywhere as Hales tried to work to leg, but it bobbled instead into no-man's land in the covers
up on the toes, pushed to point
swings into a pull, but can't time the shot. Full marks for the flourish though
down the track, another walloped shot that takes an inside edge through fine leg! Root is making his own luck at the moment
deep into the crease, wristily worked to square leg
loses his line
slipping down the leg-side
rotating the strike
heaved to deep square leg
a beautiful steer through the absent cordon, glided late and picking off the width
short and cut furiously through point
another glide through third man, picking off the width once more
swung violently out through deep square leg, two bounces and no cutting that off. England are cooking
driven out into the covers once more, a nice measured stroke

top edge, and gone! A short ball from Rabada, pulled aggressively but not middled, and that spiralled high down to Morkel on the edge of the rope. Another fine innings from a man who is back to form for England
turned off the hip, and Buttler falls first ball! A brilliant take by Duminy at leg gully, scooped low as it flew hard
up on the toes, punched out to the covers
outside off, and left alone, angled across the left-hander
back of a length, width outside off, Morgan has a flash but can't connect
Morgan continues to play himself in
clipped to the leg side
blotted into the off side.
short, and swept uppishly to deep midwicket. Duminy hovers but takes the ball on the bounce, didn't quite carry
quicker and flatter, tucked to square leg
behind the line to defend down the track
forward and pushed to cover
an ambitious reverse thwack - sort of a sweep but much more intent involved. But can't connect cleanly
dancing at the crease, Morgan eager to climb into Tahir but this one is too wide to get much more than a toe-end on the ball
full length and drilled out to midwicket
outside off, keeps low as Root gets up on his toes to punch into the covers
nurdled into the gap as Root keeps the kettle boiling
up on the toes, and pushed to cover
attempted steer into the off side, Morgan not yet found his range
dabbed to midwicket to keep the strike
outside off, angled across Morgan who can't connect with a cut through the covers
dabbed behind point
short and pulled high over midwicket
short and wide, Root has a wallop but the timing doesn't match the intent
width and drilled out to deep point
down the track, aggressive intent bordering on the manic. Morgan is sensing he's causing a blockage in England's run-rate ...
chopped out to point
Morgan finds the single
down the track, and a forearm smash, guns of steel, all the way over the rope at long-on! That's the way to do it
extra lift outside off stump, Root's attempted uppercut turns into a bit of a bail-out
eased up to long-on, a bit of pace off the ball. Root keeps the strike.
nurdled to the leg side
outside off, dabbed down to third man
bunted out to deep square leg
defended back down the pitch from deep in the crease
attempted pull but it's through Morgan like a dodgy curry. Not his most fluent day so far. I know the feeling
worked into the covers
solid stride down the pitch, pushed to mid-off
an ambitious gallop down the track, and Root is stopped in his tracks by a lifter from a good length. It raps his glove, but he's hard
open-faced steer out to deep point
still no timing for Morgan
down the track, wellied out to long-on, enough bat on ball to justify the charge, but a little frantic all the same
flat-footed slap, and Morgan's scratchy innings is brought to a merciful end. Never remotely adjusted to the changing pace of the wicket, a miscued hoick to Amla at short midwicket
steered through the covers on the front foot, gets in front of the sweeper for a couple
dug in short, climbing through outside off, left alone
gets the full bunger right up towards the boot straps, Root jabs down on it in time
back of a length outside off, drops into the crease and steers one through backward point
good length on off stump, 133kph and defended by Stokes
touch shorter, outside off and Stokes tries to force it off the back foot, gets a bottom edge down into the turf
tossed up on the stumps, worked through the leg side
stays over the wicket, pushed through on off, Stokes defends
still getting his eye in, blocked
touch shorter, drops back and pats a single through the covers, Stokes off the mark
filthy full toss and battered into the crowd! Rank from Tahir and spanked by Root... straight to a guy sitting on the grass banks, who catches it without moving, cool as you like
nurdled away off the pads through square leg for one
fired down the leg side - that's the England 200 up
at the body, Root nudges another single off his hips, moves on to 96
over the wicket, angled across on off stump, Stokes presents it a diligent straight bat
bit of width, stays in the crease, whips his hands through a late cut
back of a length outside off, opens the face and steers a couple more behind square
full around off stump, opens the face on the drive... thinks about two but he'll stay at the non-striker's end on 99
lovely shot, stroked down the ground, transferring the weight forward smoothly as Morkel overpitched
tossed up on the stumps, worked towards mid-on
flighted, comes forward and drills the ball to long-on this time - that's the hundred, his seventh in ODIs, Rootin' tootin' stuff
presses forward to defend
tossed up and punched back through mid-on
sliding down the leg side... Oh dear
serves up some more toss of the full variety and Root clubs it beyond the ropes again, his fourth six of the innings. Class dismissed
on the stumps, tapped away
back of a length, steered away through gully
skips out, swings a flat-batted hoick towards deep backward point... and it carries all the way! Power hitting in the thin Highveld air
goes back and across and taps the ball down on the off side
heaved over midwicket this time! Root collars Morkel again, into a space and bouncing away to the rope for four more
length on the stumps, clipped back towards mid-on
shortish, nudged off the hips but finds the fielder
tossed up on middle and leg, worked away through square
pushed through, slightly leg side as Root came forward, hit on the pad
Tahir is being turned into roadkill... goes down and carts the ball over the off side, just short of the rope this time
quicker legbreak, tapped off the legs
tossed up, taken on the full and swept through backward square
on the stumps, comes forward to punch down the ground
short ball, Stokes doesn't mind those, stand-and-delivered four back through wide mid-on

struck on the pads, not given... but SA review. Was it pitching in line? Didn't look like it in real time, Stokes was probably hit in front of leg, so it would have to have straightened an awful lot.. Nope, an inch or two outside, so on we go
back of a length, 138kph and flipped off the hip through backward square
another half-tracker from Rabada and this is hammered with fire-breathing malevolence beyond the ropes at deeps square leg. Humpty
pushed back into the on side, Rabada collects in his follow through
pinged off the legs, good stop at midwicket but Stokes beats the direct hit to the other end
wicket-to-wicket line, keeper up to the stumps, punched down the ground to bring up 250
touch straight, clipped through backward square leg
reverse sweep, whipped through third man! That's gone like a shot, such fast hands, right off the middle of the saucepan
on the stumps, tucked away for one more off the legs
good length outside off, Root tries the same reversey-percy trick and nearly falls on his face as the ball flies through to de Kock
full in the blockhole, bunted down the ground
length ball outside off, maybe a cutter, Root attempts another reverse swat... and misses again
full and straight, can't get right under it, driven firmly to long-on
angled across on the full, Stokes power ballads the ball through the covers, the dive on the ropes is to no avail
by the beard of Zeus! In the slot from Wiese, length around off stump, Stokes leans back and rifles it over the ropes at wide long-on
pitched up and this time Stokes drills the ball back down the ground for one

oh no, Root and Stokes are standing together mid-pitch... This has not gone to plan. Root spanked a drive into the stumps at the non-striker's end, set off, stuttered, called again as the ball ricocheted to short midwicket - Stokes then started and stopped as Wiese hared after it and de Kock has a simple job to complete the run-out
on the stumps, pushed down the ground
pushed across, swing and a miss
length ball on the stumps, Behardien fields in his follow through
half forward, chipped down the ground, safely through mid-on
full on the stumps, Stokes manages to work a drive wide of the man on the fence for two
punched through the covers, keeps the strike
good length on off stump, Stokes swings his banjo, pulls one down the ground
fullish, slower ball, Moeen doesn't time a drive down the ground
pitched up and driven through the covers
back of a length outside off, Moeen flails at it and gets a bottom edge straight down
slower ball from Wiese and again Moeen can't get hold of it, an inside edge bounces back to the bowler
pushed across, very wide but inside the guidelines - decent over to finish Wiese's otherwise unprepossessing allocation
slower ball, short and swirling away from Stokes as he swings and misses
at the body, Stokes can only nudge it away through midwicket
stays back and pulls into the ground through square leg
tries to get to the yorker in but Stokes flexes his muscles and guns a straight thump through mid-on and away
backs away and clubs a single down the ground - Stokes shakes his head but that's his 50, from just 33 balls

on the hip and Moeen flicks it sweetly... but straight towards deep backward square leg, where Amla dives to take an excellent tumbling catch! Morkel gets a wicket with his final delivery and England are dragged ever closer to earth
full and wide, Stokes throws the arms through a punishing drive to the cover sweeper
shortish, on the hips, deflects behind square
pitched up towards the blockhole, driven hard down the ground for one
back of a length, Jordan sits in the crease and swivels one through square leg
fired full and wide, Stokes tries to lever it over the covers, the bat turns slightly in the hands and it rolls to the sweeper for one more
pitched up and splunked down the ground to long-on
low full toss, Jordan reaches out to slap through cover point

leans back and attempts to smack the ball into Pretoria... but he picks out long-off! A lively intervention from Stokes, keeping England's legs whirring, but they are beginning to look like Wile E Coyote after run over a cliff edge

two in two, Jordan sends it down the throat of deep extra cover! Canny slower ball from Abbott, anticipating the big shot and Jordan lemming-ed it straight to the man on the fence. England could get bowled out here
dug in short, outside off and Willey looks at it disdainfully... Fine by the umpires
beaten! Lovely delivery, particularly to a No. 9 who's face one ball, draws him forward and past the outside edge
pitched up and this time he swings through the line, drives to the cover sweeper
good length, rolls his fingers over it, Rashid tries a cute late dab and misses - super over from Abbott
pitched up and dug out into the leg side, bobbles wide of Rabada in his follow through
short ball, Rashid swishes and misses... Looked like it might have been over his head from the side angle
scooped off the legs for a couple wide of the man at deep square
pitched up outside off, driven into the ground, back to Rabada
full and straight but not quite full enough and Rashid whips it wristily through square leg, this time he beats the man out there to get four - 300 up
clobbered! Full toss from Rabada and Rashid absolutely nails a homer over wide long-off
slower ball, Willey rolls his wrists on a pull, gets a bottom edge behind square
pitched up and kerplunked through the covers, hard running from Rashid ensures they get two
now Willey gets in on the act, smoking six into the crowd at deep square leg! Picks it up off a length and biffs it beyond the ropes with a grimace
low full toss from Abbott, can only squeeze this out through the covers
full outside off, dips in late as Rashid swings and misses
a low full toss to finish, Rashid heaves it into the leg side, to the man on the fence - just a single to finish with

inn2.comm: outside off, swinging away from the left-hander, left alone
good shape from Willey, swinging towards the cordon
swing once again, but de Kock saw it early, planted his front foot, and thumped a full-faced drive through the covers. Sweet strike
driven again, without timing to mid-off
on the back foot, Willey's probing line demanding respect as de Kock defends on the back foot and looks around for the ricochet off the crease

reaching for the drive and connecting exquisitely! Seemed not to have got to the pitch, but it didn't matter as he cantilevered his body into position and crashed the hands through the line. De Kock has started with intent ...
defended on a good line
full length, threatening to swing, threatening to nibble off the pitch, tidy work
driven from deep in the crease, cover scoops to field
back of a length with just a snifter of width, and Amla lamps that effortlessly through point for a boundary. Elegance
squared up on middle and leg, and defended to short midwicket
forward and blocked out to cover
up on the toes and defended back down the pitch
tight line outside off, swinging away, demanding respect
probing length (ooh, stop it, Aggers...) and picked up at midwicket
up on the toes, and punched to point
unlucky bounce for Jordan in the covers, as the ball hops over his shoulder
wristy drill to point
clipped firmly off the pads and that's sharp work from Rashid, who gathers and shies in one move, and de Kock was on auto-run for that shot. He wasn't in the frame!
up on the toes and defended
defended to mid-on with a full face of the blade
straying too straight and de Kock doesn't miss out on those! Whipped off the toes, with almost an inside-out drive, no cutting that off
good riposte, yorker, speared into the toes, and well dug out
ambitious appeal as Topley slides one into the pads. The angle was taking the ball down to fine leg so they decide not to review
wristily eased out to point, working with the angle across the right-hander
tight line on off stump, drawing an appreciative defence
right up in the slot for a full-blooded drive. Amla eases his front foot forward, using the width created by the left-arm line and slotting a drive through the covers. Delectable
eased into the covers
driven into the covers
flicked derisively off the toes and clean as a whistle through backward square. That was gorgeous
full-faced defence, back down the track
defended out to point
up on the toes, drilled to point once more
a full floaty half-volley, that's a poor ball by any standards but what a shot to dissect it with! Rammed through the covers with a big stride and a flowing blade
better length but too wide, and de Kock's open-faced steer is picked up at third man
slower ball, right up in the blockhole. Amla holds his stroke back and tickles a drive to cover
on the pads, angling across the left-hander and clipped out to deep square leg
back into the crease, and nurdled into the leg side
width, and driven uppishly through the gap at gully. A deliberate plant down to third man, and suddenly the singles are cascading through!
wicket-to-wicket, defended on off stump
on the pads, sliding down the leg side
pushed to cover
back on the crease, and defended with a touch of unease.
misdirected, sliding down the leg-side
ooh, nasty lift from a very full length and de Kock feels that right on the splice of his bat. His hands will be vibrating for an over or two
on the pads, and that's a poor follow-up, too short and leg-sided, and helped round the corner
up on the toes, defended into the leg-side
stunning straight drive! That is one for the snappers, a gorgeous full face of the bat as Topley over-pitches from round the wicket and is thumped straight back whence he came
up onto the toes, deflected out into the leg-side
slower ball, Amla waits, and waits, and waits. And dabs a leg-stump half-volley to square leg
solidly into line
solid defence, poked out to point with a perpendicular bat
banged in short, Amla goes across his stumps in an attempt to paddle a pull, but he's forced to duck his head in at the last minute as Stokes saw him go ...
full length, angled in, blocked to mid-on
up on the toes, punched out to cover
crunched out to point with a checked flow of the bat
driven into the covers
flat-footed waft, a bit stuck on the crease
beautiful, Amla shuffles across the crease like table-football goalkeeper, and utterly bunts that through the covers. Nailed it
that shuffling at the crease shuffles with Jordan's line. Too far outside off

exceptional footwork, dancing across the crease once again and it makes no difference where Jordan bowls, as long as it arrives at the standard pace, it is going to be dispatched ... through fine leg this time
worked into the leg-side for a single
drilled into the covers to keep the strike. Not the best of introductory overs from Jordan
tip and run, as the Powerplay is taken
very wide outside off, responding to Amla's premeditated movements. Tapped out to point
full length, angled across the left-hander and pushed to cover
pulled out to midwicket, a measured steer of a shot

slightly short, Amla nails his pull and it is onto Rashid so quickly at fine leg that he ended up nutmegging himself in his attempt to gather. In fact, his knee got caught as he slid. Lucky that didn't do him some damage, Simon Jones-style
another calm single to keep the strike.
back of a length, dabbed out to point
on the toes, clipped out to midwicket
crunched out to point, reaching for the stroke and not quite timing it as the fielder leaps to gather
flogged! Up, up and away, over deep midwicket, just a shuffle into position as Jordan drops his length a millimetre, and that has been launched, North Korea-style ... look out Seoul!
hops into line
defended into the crease, a good recovery at the end of another bruising over
nudged into the gap, more calm accumulation
short, and pulled hard through midwicket
width again, as Amla slides across his crease again, and dabs a deflection out to point
short, pulled hard in front of square, well timed but the sweeper doesn't have to move to gather
nurdled down to third man
solid line and length to finish the over
width, and that is a lovely glide through third man. Just nudging into the gap, using the pace of the outfield rather than any ferocity of stroke
slower delivery, it grips on landing and demands respect
blocked on the back foot
wide again, and filleted through backward point
worked out to point
turned into the leg side from a fuller length
flogged into the covers, applying some humpty from the get-go
outside off, and this one keeps low as Amla's bat came scything through. Something to ponder ...
measured push into the covers
sharp spin but too short, and de Kock blatters this one through the leg-side, Willey slides to gather, and he's blowing. Pretty airless at this altitude
patted back to the bowler
on the pads, nudged to square leg, a tidy introduction
round the wicket, attempted chop into the covers but can't time it

fifty for de Kock, another pricelessly composed innings. The milestone comes up with a dab to point. Exactly 50 balls, and he has been serenity personified in this chase, just as he was at Bloemfontein
turned to square leg
another clam plucking of the gap
clipped uppishly through midwicket, a two-step down the track and working with the spin
solid defence on the back foot to complete the over
back of a length, threatening to spin but skidding straight on, walloped to mid-off with static feet
leaning back, making room as Rashid skidded one onto his off stump, a slap through backward point and Topley does brilliantly to cut off the four with a sprawling dive
cracked into the covers, South Africa are looking incredibly solid against pace and spin alike
full stride forward, pushed to mid-on
turning from off to leg, helped round the corner
solidly forward, poked into the covers, South Africa remain very, very on course in a hefty chase
over the wicket, tight to off stump, pushed back down the pitch
whipped uppishly out to midwicket, just the single but sweetly timed. The hundred is up and South Africa are breezing along
nurdled into the gap
worked into the leg-side, Ali varying his pace
on the pads, tucked to square leg
on the pads and turned out to the leg side for another easy single
tossed up on the stumps, worked back to the bowler's left, Rashid dives after it
pushed across the left-hander, who goes back to cut one through point
legbreak on off stump, swishes at it and gets an inside edge on to his pads
tossed up and higher, opens the face and slides a drive through backward point, well stopped on the boundary
pushed through on the stumps, tries to flick to leg
flat trajectory, pushed back to the bowler
angled in and tucked into the leg side
tossed up, Amla goes across and flicks into a gap, jogs one as the throw comes in
drops back in the crease, slides another single behind square
pushed through a bit quicker outside off and Amla is beaten trying to cut
angled in on the stumps, can't get it away
tossed up, uses the feet and punches down the ground for one
spinning away on off stun, reaches out and strokes through the covers
tossed up on the stumps, de Kock chops down on it
tight lines from Rashid, knocked back to the bowler
flighted on leg stump, possible the googly, tucked away through square leg
tossed up, driven uppishly back through mid-off
on the pads, de Kock happy to continue grinding corn with a glance to fine leg
tossed up and punched towards mid-off coming forwards
makes a bit of room and drives through the covers for one
angled in on the stumps, worked back down the ground to long-on
utterly boshed! De Kock goes down on one knee and breaks the stranglehold with a brutal slam dunk over deep midwicket
pushed through outside off, dabs at it and misses
drops short and de Kock slots another four over midwicket, pulled comfortably into the gap
Amla cruises on like a shark in the deep, taps into a gap for his fifty
flighted, gets a bit of bounce on off stump, leading edge from de Kock
leg-stump line, beaten by the googly as he swings across the line
on the pads, flicked down to fine leg
tossed up on off stump, pushed back down the ground
flighted, comes forward and strokes one past the bowler
on the stumps, nudged towards midwicket
pushed through and Amla flicks this a bit squarer to get one past midwicket
flighted, comes forward on off stump, strokes one down the ground
on the stumps, clipped back through mid-on for one more
wristy from de Kock, gets down early and tosses this over his shoulder to deep backward square leg, like a man disposing of an apple core
angled in flat with the arm, skimmed to fine leg for one more
outside off, goes back and forces a cut into the covers
full toss from Rashid and de Kock happy-slaps it out towards the long-off boundary... plop! Right on to the rope
turned off his legs for one
floated up and steered through backward point on the drive
Rashid drops short and de Kock cashes in again, wheels his arms round through a pull to backward square
pushed through outside off, stays a bit low as Quinny cuts and finds the fielder
pitched up and driven into the ground towards mid-off
back of a length and Amla teases England by edging four to third man, opened the face and played it late, takes SA past 150
shortish, on the hips and worked through backward square
length ball, punched into the covers

down the leg side, de Kock swipes and misses... or does he? Jordan and Buttler go up for the caught behind, the umpires signals wide, and England review. Which might save them an extra but won't get de Kock out, as there was clearly a flick of the pad on the way through
full outside off, 133kph and driven off the inside half of the bat to mid-off
legbreak tossed up outside off, stroked through the covers
goes back, the ball spinning in on off stump, clipped into his front pad
outside leg, nudged to the fielder square
flighted on off stump, pushed towards mid-off
pushed across outside the line of off, goes back and dabs behind point
length ball on the pads, nudged to square leg
on the pads from Jordan, clipped through backward square - that's a new record opening partnership in ODIs for SA against England
short and wide and cracked like a rifle shot through point, straight to the sweeper
full and straight, hit on the pads but probably outside leg... Amla then has to hurry back as cover dashes in
length outside off, steered to backward point
fullish on off stump, driven along the carpet to mid-off
short ball from Jordan and de Kock punishes the last delivery in the over, swatting a pull high out toward deep midwicket... Fractionally short of the rope
fullish around off stump, turned to midwicket
goes back and nudges off his hips through square
good length on the legs, tucked through backward square - back for a second and on to 99
Stokes fires in the yorker - but Quinny is equal to it
short of a length on the hips and nurdled away for one more - that's de Kock's hundred, his second of the series, 10th over all. Playing another blinder today
length outside off, keeps a bit low as Amla swishes and misses
full toss from Jordan, danger for de Kock, he manages to fend it away through square - no-ball called
Amla backs away and Jordan fires the ball in full outside off
on the stumps, pulled towards midwicket
full and tailing in, Amla drives into the ground to extra cover
banged in short, 137kph and climbing high over Amla's abortive pull
angling in, nudged away to leg
overpitched and that is crunched past mid-off for four, de Kock is batting on a cloud right now
slower ball, gets away without any damage this time - but those extras proved costly for Jordan
comes across and hits on the up through the covers
short and clubbed! De Kock latches on and rattles another boundary, powered over midwicket
slightly leg side, flicked venomously down to the right of fine leg... good diving grab from Topley prevents four
pitched up, driven to the man at extra cover
on the stumps, whipped serenely through midwicket, all timing and wrists... and four
speared in on the legs, glanced through backward square for one more
pitched up on the pads, Amla tickles another brace behind square with his feather duster
angled across, Amla opens the face and runs one to third man
short ball, unthreatening at Willey's speed and de Kock swings it up up and away over fine leg, another enormous six!
full outside off, driven into the ground, Willey fields
tries to heave over the leg side, gets this one wrong... but a toe-ended loft lands short of long-on running in
fired in full, Amla drops the bat on off stump, squirts it out through point
over the wicket, angled across outside off, steered towards point
straighter line, waits for it and skims a leg glance fine
full on the pads, de Kock fillets four more, between the two men set back on the leg side - that's the 200 stand up, this opening partnership will not be broken
slower ball but de Kock picks it, wields his wrecking ball and slams the ball hiiiiiiiigh out towards wide long-on
full on the legs, flicked to the man in the deep
in the air... but safe! Amla gets in a bit of a tangle pulling but it sails behind Morgan at square leg
clipped off the pads
pitched up, driven back past the bowler to long-on
full on the stumps, blocked into the leg side
pitched up, outside leg stump, Amla swats a couple through square leg
dug in short and Amla whirls into a pull, wide of fine leg for another brace
on the pads, Amla carves himself six over fine leg! Silk and steel in those wrists, it flew beyond the ropes, even if Willey might have initially thought fine leg was in the game
full and bunted towards mid-on
pitched up and driven firmly down the ground for one
pushed towards mid-on, they take on the fielder and make it comfortably enough
short ball, drops back and pulls into the ground
full and in the slot for Amla to launch a liquid cricket drive through the covers.. Dreamy
whipped leg side this time, shuffling across and pinging four more in front of deep midwicket. Amla moving sinuously into the 90s
round the wicket, tossed up on the pads, de Kock flicks it away
angled in and worked through midwicket for one
quicker on off stump, de Kock drops back and taps towards point
four more, lashed through backward point! De Kock is trampling on England, this was superbly placed, between two men and it races away
floated up and punched through the covers
reaches out and flumps one more down the ground
turn from off stump, deflected to point
angled defence into the off side
a fast, flat pull through midwicket, but straight to the fielder
tossed up, and dipping on de Kock as his shot came through the line. toe-ended, in the air to mid-off, but doesn't quite carry!
this one does carry, however, a tired welly to cover, and a wonderful innings comes to an end!
outside off, a back-cut to point. The end of a successful over, shock horror!
tossed up on the pads, tucked to midwicket
filthy beamer, and Amla is stumped off a no-ball ... which unfortunately doesn't count! Buttler brought his gloves down as Amla brought his bat down, and beat him to the punch ... free hit coming up
worked to midwicket
pumped off the back foot, down to long on to get off the mark
on the pads, easy as you like, whipped to midwicket. And Hashim Amla has his 22nd ODI hundred! Another serene performance from a man who has rocketed back to form since the Cape Town Test ...
stand and deliver! Wiese was sent in to give it a smack, and so he does! Pounded high over long-off
reverse sweep, and bowled! Well, that was short and to the point ...
dabbed down the ground
a slip in place now, that's a novelty in this innings. Big spin from fractionally back of a length, poked into the covers
tossed up and blocked
more sharp spin as Rashid rips it from leg to off, worked into the covers off the back foot
slower, teasier, if you will, met on the half-volley with the toe-end of the bat
googly, and a big appeal as Faf plays outside that and is rapped on the pad. Turning too much though, and England have used their review anyway
onto the back foot, worked to square leg
down the track and padded into the covers
skidding onto a nudge to leg, another single to the cause
skidding on again, pushed back into the crease
standing tall on the back foot and a quick single to mid-off
Faf keeps the strike with a nurdle, as South Africa seek to restore some calm
pushed off the back foot to cover
sharp spin for the googly, but too sharp, and sliding down leg
solidly forward and a risky single as Buttler hurtles round from behind the stumps to gather and fling at the non-striker's end. Might have been tight...
wafted out to extra cover
tossed up into the blockhole, eased into the covers again
angled out to leg
du Plessis keeps the strike, but kudos to Rashid, another solid night's work. He's been England's liveliest option
sliding down leg, get em in extras, lad
dabbed out to midwicket
Amla advances, Faf adjusts, nurdled to leg
slashed hard, outside off, through the vacant slip cordon, no cutting that off. This goose is all but cooked ...
pumped over the covers! Striding forward, leaning back, elegance takes a back seat as raw power flows through the line of the ball. Fetch!
nudged to the leg side, another cherry-picked single
patted back to the bowler
flicked into the leg-side as Stokes returns for a final burst
on the pads, tucked to square leg
angled defence, out to point
aggressive full length, clipped to midwicket
smashed down the ground! A skip into position and a bosh of bat through the line
slower ball, on the back foot, dabbed down to third man
up on the toes, and turned to short backward square
round the wicket, banged in short, and met with a whippy pull out to deep midwicket
on the toes, turned to backward square leg
too short, too leg-sided, too easy. Du Plessis was waiting on the back foot, fully in anticipation of a short one in the slot. Another poor ball from Jordan
down the leg side, Jordan is adamant there was something on that, but it was a low full toss as well, so he didn't really deserve anything better
shorter and sharper, that was livelier! Du Plessis gets the hurry-up ...
full face of the bat, pumped down the ground. England can't lay a glove on South Africa at the moment
wristy flick in front of square on the leg side, Amla so easily into position
forward and pushed to mid-on
whoops, another one
pushed to mid-on from a full length
drilled into the covers
wristy and sumptuous, clean through the covers! That's just delightful
banged in short, that's Jordan's one for the over. Odd and anachronistic rule that that is ...
short, thumped round the corner. Jordan's round-the-wicket ploy is working about as well as Centurion's electricity supply
too full, on the pads, tickled fine, I think Jordan fancies an early bath
short again, helped round the corner, easy peasy
round the wicket, way down the leg side, that is just a bit rubbish really
outside off, and snicked through to the keeper! Jordan finally finds a line that doesn't get walloped or wided, and that's the end of a sensational match-winning innings
wide outside off, a miscued drill and Jordan gathers
England are just prendring le Michel now. A vile wide full toss, a toe-ende thump into the covers, and very nearly a catch - expect of course it is a no-ball and a free hit ...
free hit and help yourself! Smashed gratuitously over the bowler's head!
on the pads, nudged away, South Africa have rampaged to an outstanding seven-wicket win!
